text: Divide and conquer is an old story in America, and racial hatred has always been part of keeping the rich and powerful on top. We cannot fall for this ugly blame game – especially while so many Americans are suffering.

Real leadership is about deescalating violence by listening to Black Americans who can’t watch another friend or neighbor die at the hands of police. It’s ordering DOJ to step in and stop racist policing. It’s pushing the Senate to pass a bill to fundamentally change policing.

Trump fans the flames of violence and white supremacy. Race, religion, heritage – the more factions the better in Trump’s America of fear and hate. When we turn against each other, we can’t unite for equality and justice – or fight back against Trump’s failures and corruption.

Exactly one year ago, an act of unspeakable evil shook West Texas. Heidi and I continue to lift up in prayer the victims, their families, and the Midland-Odessa community. We remember the families and loved ones of those who died and we pray that they feel God’s loving embrace. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EgwOoE4WoAEJXhz.jpg

Then, a hurricane destroys it. You have no power, water, or shelter.

Now imagine, amid all that, a heat wave--statistically deadliest weather event possible.

This is reality for SW Louisiana.
